title: Bury college in lockdown over 'threat' as staff and students told to stay indoors
text:
Bury college in lockdown over 'weapon' threat as staff and students told to stay indoors Bury College, on Market Street, in the town centre, is understood to have received a threat Share Get daily   Could   
A college has been put in ‘lock down’ due to a security issue, say police. 
Bury College in Greater Manchester, is understood to have received a threat. 
The college is understood to have been put on ‘lock down’, with teachers being told to stay in their classrooms. 
Some students are also being held inside the building, the Manchester Evening News reports. Read More 
Greater Manchester Police confirmed they are at the scene, but have not revealed any further details. 
Dozens of concerned students and parents have been sharing messages on social media. 
One Twitter user wrote: “Any info on what’s happening at Bury College? Why aren’t the student allowed outside?” 
Tommy Heap posted: “Any one no what’s going on at Bury College. No-one Allowed in or out..bit strange!” 
Police are now searching each building for a threat, reports say from the scene. 
Officers are posted outside each building. 
Bury College released a statement saying: "Please note, the college is currently investigating a potential threat to our security. 
"We are in communications with the police, following their advice and have instigated our alert procedures as a precaution. 
"We will update further as we receive more information."
